TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit DBConcurrencyException extends System.SystemException

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown by the during an insert, update, or delete operation if the number of rows affected equals zero.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Data.Common.DataAdapter> examines the number of rows affected by the execution of each insert, update, or delete operation, and throws this exception if the number equals zero. This exception is generally caused by a concurrency violation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default constructor initializes any fields to their default values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception inner) cil managed

Docs.param: The text string describing the details of the exception.
A reference to an inner exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can create a new exception that catches an earlier exception. The code that handles the second exception can use the additional information from the earlier exception, also called an inner exception, to examine the cause of the initial error.

MemberSignature.Value: public DBConcurrencyException (string message, Exception inner, System.Data.DataRow[] dataRows);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception inner, class System.Data.DataRow[] dataRows) cil managed

Docs.param: The error message that explains the reason for this exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference ( in Visual Basic) if no inner exception is specified.
An array containing the objects whose update failure generated this exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void CopyToRows(class System.Data.DataRow[] array) cil managed

Docs.param: The one-dimensional array of objects to copy the objects into.
Docs.summary: Copies the objects whose update failure generated this exception, to the specified array of objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When performing batch updates with the <xref:System.Data.Common.DataAdapter.ContinueUpdateOnError%2A> property of the <xref:System.Data.Common.DataAdapter> set to `true`, this exception is thrown if all row updates fail. In this case, this <xref:System.Data.DBConcurrencyException> contains <xref:System.Data.DataRow> objects for all rows whose update failed, rather than just the one <xref:System.Data.DataRow> object in <xref:System.Data.DBConcurrencyException.Row%2A>, and the affected <xref:System.Data.DataRow> objects can be retrieved by calling <xref:System.Data.DBConcurrencyException.CopyToRows%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyToRows (System.Data.DataRow[] array, int arrayIndex);
.method public hidebysig instance void CopyToRows(class System.Data.DataRow[] array, int32 arrayIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: The one-dimensional array of objects to copy the objects into.
The destination array index to start copying into.
Docs.summary: Copies the objects whose update failure generated this exception, to the specified array of objects, starting at the specified destination array index.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When performing batch updates with the <xref:System.Data.Common.DataAdapter.ContinueUpdateOnError%2A> property of the <xref:System.Data.Common.DataAdapter> set to `true`, this exception is thrown if all row updates fail. In this case, this <xref:System.Data.DBConcurrencyException> contains <xref:System.Data.DataRow> objects for all rows whose update failed, rather than just the one <xref:System.Data.DataRow> object in <xref:System.Data.DBConcurrencyException.Row%2A>, and the affected <xref:System.Data.DataRow> objects can be retrieved by calling <xref:System.Data.DBConcurrencyException.CopyToRows%2A>.

Docs.exception: The parameter is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the that generated the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use <xref:System.Data.DBConcurrencyException.Row%2A> to retrieve the value of the <xref:System.Data.DataRow> row that generated the <xref:System.Data.DBConcurrencyException>. Setting the value of the <xref:System.Data.DataRow> has no effect.
When performing batch updates with the <xref:System.Data.Common.DataAdapter.ContinueUpdateOnError%2A> property of the <xref:System.Data.Common.DataAdapter> set to `true`, this exception is thrown if all row updates fail. In this case, this <xref:System.Data.DBConcurrencyException> contains <xref:System.Data.DataRow> objects for all rows whose update failed, rather than just the one <xref:System.Data.DataRow> object in <xref:System.Data.DBConcurrencyException.Row%2A>, and the affected <xref:System.Data.DataRow> objects can be retrieved by calling <xref:System.Data.DBConcurrencyException.CopyToRows%2A>.
Serialization support does not exist for <xref:System.Data.DataRow> objects. Therefore, if you serialize a <xref:System.Data.DBConcurrencyException> object, the value of the <xref:System.Data.DBConcurrencyException.Row%2A> property in the serialized version of the object is set to a null value.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of rows whose update failed, generating this exception.
Docs.value: An integer containing a count of the number of rows whose update failed.
